bibl.title: Artemidoros of Ephesos and Strabo of Amasia. Common Traditions of Greek Cultural Geography and Strabo's Decisive Importance in the History of Reception of Artemidoros' Geographoumena.
Intorno al Papiro di Artemidoro. II. Geografia e cartografia. Atti del Convegno internazionale del 27 novembre 2009 presso la Società Geografica Italiana, Villa Celimontana, Roma

bibl.note: 1. Artemidoros of Ephesos as Strabo's source, model and literary rival. - 2. Stephanos of Byzantion, Pliny the Elder, and Strabo as our main sources of Artemidoros' fragments. - 3. The decisive importance of Strabo's Geographika for any hypothesis about Artemidoros' Geographoumena.
bibl.seg: Johannes Engels, Artemidoros of Ephesos and Strabo of Amasia. Common Traditions of Greek Cultural Geography and Strabo's Decisive Importance in the History of Reception of Artemidoros' Geographoumena.

Claudio Gallazzi, Bärbel Kramer & Salvatore Settis (edd.), Intorno al Papiro di Artemidoro. II. Geografia e cartografia. Atti del Convegno internazionale del 27 novembre 2009 presso la Società Geografica Italiana, Villa Celimontana, Roma = Colloquium (Milano, 2012) pp. 139-155.

1. Artemidoros of Ephesos as Strabo's source, model and literary rival. - 2. Stephanos of Byzantion, Pliny the Elder, and Strabo as our main sources of Artemidoros' fragments. - 3. The decisive importance of Strabo's Geographika for any hypothesis about Artemidoros' Geographoumena.
